author: m.kalinin
content: A question about fork digest. Why only the current version is mixed in? Why not the whole `Fork` object?

author: jonny.derp
content: <@425572898787426305>   so fork digest is calculated from the fork data object...which includes current version and genesis validator root.  The fork object includes previous version, current version and epoch - no genesis validator root.  Are u asking why forkdata doesn't have the other fields of the fork object?

author: m.kalinin
content:
> Are u asking why forkdata doesn't have the other fields of the fork object?
Yes, I was curious about this. But then realised that even if contentious fork would have a similar fork, likewise ETH vs ETC forks, it could decouple the fork version with setting a few highest bits to `1`.
